title: My CI builds broke, something changed with build dependencies or ...
body:
I have a jenkins jobs that builds all of my things every night.

The build at Apr 30, 2017 2:28:42 AM succeeded, using `develop` at 0a9beccc4a4d7336e002d1fbcc2cf77c2d41ecbb.

Last night's build failed while building `direnv` and I'm trying to understand why and what might have changed.  I tried another build this morning and it also failed.

When I cd'ed into the workspace of the failed build and ran

```
spack stage direnv
pushd /path/to/stage/dir/goes/here
spack env direnv bash
cd direnv-2.11.3
go build
```

it fails with

```
_/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-sc1-working-dir/workspace/sc1-daily-build/spack/var/spack/stage/direnv-2.11.3-wixlanate5jvl752xxua5j5wzprohhvn/direnv-2.11.3
./log.go:47: undefined: log.Output
```

That line's a simple:

```
        log.Output(2, msg)
```

Out of habit I checked which go compiler I was using and found that I was invoking the old bootstrap compiler:

```
$ which go
/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-sc1-working-dir/workspace/sc1-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/go-bootstrap-1.4-bootstrap-20161024-bjdc3swkpiscyoysx5hu6oxleaovrtt5/bin/go
```

direnv has a build dependency on go, go has a build dependency on go-bootstrap.


Here's the base environment in which spack is running:

```
$ (module purge; echo ${PATH} | perl -lape 's/:/\n/g')
/blah/blah/blah/spack/bin
/usr/local/bin
/usr/bin
/opt/ibutils/bin
/usr/local/sbin
/usr/sbin
```

On a possibly related note, I noticed that the version of go that has been installed is `go@1.8.1`, in spite of having it pinned to `go@1.8` in my `packages.yaml` file.

```yaml
  go:
    version: [1.8]
    # tests have two false positives, user_namespaces and threads/exceptions
    variants: ~test
```
